meanings.definition: Talk in a low, monotonous voice
meanings.sent1: She was chuntering about her day in a tired voice.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was chuntering during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The chuntering of the old radio made it hard to hear the music.
meanings.sent4: The chuntering of the distant waterfall was soothing.
meanings.sent5: His chuntering voice put me to sleep.

meanings.sent1: He kept chuntering about the cold weather all day.
meanings.sent2: Stop chuntering and do something about it!
meanings.sent3: The cat started chuntering when its food bowl was empty.
meanings.sent4: The chuntering of the engine signaled trouble ahead.
meanings.sent5: Her chuntering was like background noise in the office.

meanings.sent1: The stream was chuntering softly in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The wind chuntered through the trees all night.
meanings.sent3: The chuntering of the coffee machine filled the cafe.
meanings.sent4: The chuntering of the crowd grew louder as the show started.
meanings.sent5: The chuntering of the bees was a peaceful backdrop to the garden.
